description: 1978 Corvette - Brand New 350/350 HP Crate Engine, Rebuilt Automatic Transmission, Power Steering, Power 4- Wheel Disc Brakes, Factory Air Condition, Telescopic Steering Wheel W/ Tilt, AM/FM Cassette Player, Power Windows, Remote Driver Mirror, Dual Color Keyed Side Mirrors, MSD Ignition Wires, Headers, New Side Pipe Exhaust, 44K Actual Miles, Original Keys, Finished In Frost Beige Exterior, Brown Leather Interior, Aluminum Wheels W/ New BFG Tires, Overall A Very Nice Well Cared For Low Mile Corvette, Thousands Spent On Mechanics, Very Dependable Cruiser! Corvette Celebrated It's 25th Anniversary In 1978!

1978 was the Corvette's twenty fifth anniversary, and all 78's featured silver anniversary nose and fuel door emblems. A new fastback rear window was the most dramatic and noticeable styling change, giving the ten-year-old C3 Corvette body style a fresh lease on life. The fixed-glass fastback benefited both aerodynamics and increased the usable luggage space behind the seats while improving rearward visibility in the bargain. A shade was installed that could be pulled forward to cover the rear compartment to protect cargo and carpet against the unrelenting sun. The tachometer and speedometer were redesigned to match the new ''aircraft styled'' center console and gauge cluster first seen the previous year. Redesigned interior door panels were also new as well as an actual glove box was added in front of the passenger seat, replacing the map pockets of previous years.

Having been introduced in 1968 and continued through the 1982 model year, the Corvette C3 was one of the longest running sports cars of its time. With a whole host of GM's latest technology, the Corvette represented the best of the best. The 1978-1979 models featured a bunch of changes that would give the already ten year old design a new bit of style. Most notable was the rear glass fastback style which not only increased cargo capacity but also lowered aerodynamic drag. Other new features included a new ''aircraft inspired'' center gauge cluster, passenger glovebox, and a new dual intake for the L82 trim. The L82 was a mid range performance option in the lineup but could do 0-60 in 6.6 seconds and hit 127 mph, which were impressive numbers for the day.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this excellent bargain 1979 Corvette. Finished in factory black, the exterior of the car is in decent shape. The bodywork is straight and intact but the paint has some fading and small chips here and there. Trim is intact and the glass looks good. Factory aluminum wheels are fitted on Firestone tires that have good tread. The interior is in nice shape, with comfortable bucket seats that show minimal wear. The dash is in good shape and all gauges appear to work, Car is equipped with power windows and power locks and the interior fan blows. The dome light works as well.
These Corvettes represent a bargain in the classic car market and they have good performance and a unique driving experience. The cars are easy to work on and have a cult following.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

Unless otherwise noted, All vehicles are sold AS IS, No Warranty Expressed or Implied. All sales final.

automobile.  53,000 actual miles, automatic. . Everything works including headlights, clock, and antenna. All of this work was done to make this car 100% reliable.  All oem take off parts go with the car. I wanted to be able to take it anywhere without a concern. This is an excellent driver and its red! I'm retired and enjoy Corvettes and take excellent care of mine. And now this Corvette can be yours!

1978 Corvette '' Silver Anniversary '' - Original Matching Numbers 350 V8 Engine, 4 - Speed Transmission, 4 - Wheel Power Disc Brakes, Power Steering, Power Windows, Power Door Locks, Rear Defogger, Remote Driver Mirror, Dual Painted Sport Mirrors, AM/FM Cassette Player, Two - Tone Silver Exterior, Oyster Bucket Seat Interior, Aluminum Wheels W/ Cooper Radial G/T Tires, Tilt Telescopic Steering Wheel, Very Nice Silver Anniversary Edition! Runs & Drives Great! 1978 Marked The Corvettes 25th Anniversary!

1978 was the Corvette's twenty fifth anniversary, and all 78's featured silver anniversary nose and fuel door emblems. A new fastback rear window was the most dramatic and noticeable styling change, giving the ten-year-old C3 Corvette body style a fresh lease on life. The fixed-glass fastback benefited both aerodynamics and increased the usable luggage space behind the seats while improving rearward visibility in the bargain. A shade was installed that could be pulled forward to cover the rear compartment to protect cargo and carpet against the unrelenting sun. The tachometer and speedometer were redesigned to match the new ''aircraft styled'' center console and gauge cluster first seen the previous year. Redesigned interior door panels were also new as well as an actual glove box was added in front of the passenger seat, replacing the map pockets of previous years. Available options now included power door locks, a power antenna, dual rear speakers and a CB radio.6 The optional convenience group, introduced the previous year, now included intermittent (delay) wipers, floor mats, and the passenger side vanity mirror was an upgraded illuminated unit.

Two special editions were offered to celebrate Corvette's 25th year. Before he retired, Bill Mitchell had suggested a Silver Anniversary model in his favorite color-silver, appropriately enough-and it appeared as the $399 B2Z option package. The first two-tone paint option offered since 1961, it presented silver over a gray lower body with a separating pinstripe, plus aluminum wheels and dual ''sport'' outside mirrors as mandatory options, which added another $380 to the co

Originally assembled on March 10, 1982 and with 45k documented original miles, this 1982 Corvette is the Black/Red color combination, has a clean Carfax, and is FULLY DOCUMENTED with records since new.
Runs very well. I've used her as a daily driver several times during the fall and spring seasons.
Code correct Black exterior, code correct Dark Red leather interior, both Astro t-tops and painted t-tops included.
Numbers matching 200hp 350ci Crossfire engine, 4 speed automatic overdrive transmission, posi rear-end.

Features include air conditioning, tilt-n-tele, power windows, power steering, power brakes, power antenna, rear defrost, AM/FM radio, dual rear speakers, cargo shade, roof panel carrier, slotted aluminum wheels.

Her paint is original on the body and is in good condition with new paint on the bumpers (original paint on the plastic was fading).  Clear acrylic Astro t-tops look to be newer, and are in good shape.  All glass shows a correct date code, including the windshield. A set of taillight louver covers are included. Exterior door handles are good-vg with no rubbing or major finish issues, and original weatherstripping is still soft in places. Slotted aluminum wheels show good-very good center caps, and Goodyear Eagle GT II raised white letter tires show nearly full tread depth remaining at an average of 8/32nds.

The interior of this 1982 Corvette has NEW leather seat covers and foam. Original steering wheel and shift plate are in good condition, and the dash is free of cracks and warping. Door panels are vg, and original carpet is good-vg. Gauges are vg with minimal fade and vg lenses. GM seatbelts are vg, the car has never been smoked in, and the car has always been garaged. Interior additions include a Custom Auto Sound AM/FM stereo with 3.5mm Headphone jack input, vintage dual front and rear Bose speakers, wood shift knob, Red shift boot, and a personalized ashtray plaque. Also included is a vintage Bose AM/FM/Cassette stereo. Clock is also working. T-top strap and two sets of t-top bags are included, as well as RARE complete factory roof panel carrier. Passenger's vanity mirror is intact.

The engine in this 1982 Corvette has the original casting date January 15, 1982, and final assembly date February 8, 1982. Correct Crossfire setup, radiator hoses, ignition shielding, valve covers, a/c compressor, and air pump are all in place, and the frame is solid and rust-free.

I have added SkyLink GPS which allows you to track the car in real-time from your phone or computer and set up "geo-fence" perimeter alerts to catch a thief (or your teenage son) as soon he moves the car. The fuel pump has been upgraded to a 1985 model as recommended for better throttle response. Custom dual-pipe exhaust with crimped pipe; exhaust produces a pleasant rumble without being too loud. Included  binder of documentation consists of original window sticker, build sheet, owner's manual, warranty info, 1982 Corvette brochure, 1982 Chevrolet full line brochure, various vintage photos of the car, manuals for the added Bose stereo system, and repair records and invoices dating back to March 1982. Price is negotiable.

Here at Hollywood Motors, we pride ourselves on selling quality classic cars at affordable prices. Please keep in mind that all of our classics are pre-owned vehicles, not new vehicles. We describe these automobiles to the best of our knowledge, and place many photos on our website. We are not responsible for misprints or typos. With any pre-owned vehicle, there may be minor imperfections, and we encourage you to come and inspect our inventory in person before you buy any vehicle.

Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to offer a cherry 1978 Chevrolet Corvette.  Who doesnt love a bright red sports car?  Theres something so fascinating about a bright red Corvette that Price even wrote a song about them in 1983.  Little Red Corvette was a huge hit in the 1980s and would still sound good through the speakers of this 1978 little red Corvette.  This particular Corvette is an L-48 which features a 350 CID V8 which puts out 185 horsepower.  Backing the V8 is an optional automatic transmission.  1978 offered only a coupe body style but for those that enjoy open air driving the coupe has removable T-tops.  These T-tops offer the rigidity and styling of a coupe with the bonus of open air driving just like a convertible.  Other nice options include power steering power brakes seat belts aluminum wheels and raised white letter tires.  This particular example sports bright red both outside and inside.  The red upholstery is in great shape as is the rest of the interior.  If youre looking for an eye catching Vette look no further.  You can see this 1978 Chevrolet Corvette in greater detail in our St. Louis showroom or at www.GatewayClassicCars.com.  Please contact 618-271-3000 or

This 1979 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe for sale has a 350 C.I. V8 (Numbers Matching), Automatic Transmission, 2.56:1 Posi Rear, Correct White Exterior, Correct Red Interior, New Leather Seats, Power Windows, Power Locks, Remote Mirror, Rear Defrost, Tilt/Telescoping Wheel, AM/FM Radio w/ Panasonic Speakers, Body Colored T-Tops w/ Storage Bags, Factory Air Conditioning, 15'' Rally Wheels, Very Original Car, Said to be 66,208 Original Miles!

This 1981 Chevrolet Corvette is for sale in our Louisville KY showroom. 1981 was a year of first for the Corvette. Not only was this the first year for Corvettes to be produced at two factories but it was also the first year for the now historic Bowling Green plant. The STL plant cars were only available in solid colors while the new revolutionary bowling green plant had the capability to paint them two tone a rather extravagant option for a production car in 1981. With the odometer showing a mere 46235 actual miles this beauty has lived a pampered life. The bright red metallic paint brings out the lines of the 81 nicely. Under that long hood is the classic small block Chevy that came in the car backed by the original Turbo 350 Hydramatic transmission.  The T-tops are in excellent condition and have the tinted look which makes the red paint pop even more. Take them off and the wind will be blowing through hair in no time. With the black leather seats looking as new as the paint this Corvette has everything you would look for in a classic. The polished wheels are in excellent condition and are something that you just don"??t see any more. Options on this 1981 Chevrolet Corvette include; AC AM/FM/8-track player Glass T tops Cruise Power Brakes Power Steering Power Windows Power Locks Power Seats Telescopic/ Tilt Wheel Leather Interior Polished Aluminum Wheels Wrapped with Radial Tires that have Raised Lettering. This 1981 Chevrolet Corvette can be seen including an HD video at www.gatewayclassiccars.com call at 812-294-1555 or email

There is something very alluring about Corvettes.  They have long captivated the imaginations of generations of car enthusiasts.  If you didn't have one, you wanted one, and if you were lucky enough to own one, you cherished it.

One such “cherished” one is this beautiful L-82 powered 1979 Corvette.  Still wearing its factory applied Corvette Dark Blue Metallic finish, this car's finish has a beautiful luster.  Coordinating beautifully is its Dark Blue leather interior that is like new.  The seats, door panels, dashboard, carpeting and center console are similarly without wear.  You will also appreciate this car's abundance of comfort and convenience items, including the following:
With the exception of the stereo, all power options work as they should.  In addition, the air conditioning works, but does not currently blow cold.

Under the hood you will find the optional 225 HP L-82 350 CID V-8 engine, a $565 option that offered 30 additional horsepower over the base 350.  Fitted in just 27% of 1979 Corvettes, the L-82 engine makes this car quite rare.  This Corvette also features a 3-speed automatic transmission and dual exhaust.  Having just 25,700 original miles, this well maintained and cared for car runs as well as it looks.

A two-owner car, this Corvette has been owned by the same individual since 1984.  Under his ownership, this car took 1st Place in the NCCC East Ohio Region Championship Series in the Concours Wash & Show Class and was featured in Corvette Enthusiast magazine.

Included with sale are the original T-top covers, owner's manuals, and shop manual.  In addition, a copy of the Corvette Enthusiast magazine in which this car was featured will be provided to the next owner, as will a custom car cover.
Minor imperfections in the original paint do not detract from the overall appearance of this car.
If an extremely low mileage C3 Corvette that has been meticulously maintained is what you desire, this is the Corvette for you!
